MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Volgo and I decide to reenact a dating scene from a romance novel, and the first thing we do is buy an extra-large soft serve ice cream for two at a food cart.
Holding hands, we walk through the shopping district of St. Iris.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Volgo
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: It's like I'm dreaming. I really feel like I'm in a novel. We're walking leisurely, hand in hand, eating ice cream... If I'm dreaming, I hope I don't wake up.

Volgo is just so cute as she licks her ice cream and looks up at me with concern.
I almost forget that she is called the "Death God of Ft. Loren".

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Volgo
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
In the novel, they stop by a target shooting shop.
Lisa wants a stuffed animal as a prize, and Daniel uses his shooting skills to get it.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Volgo
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Can you get a stuffed animal for me?
Of course I will. I won't just get you a stuffed animal, but the whole stall.

When I pull Volgo's hand and storm to the shooting stall, I'm greeted by the shady-looking owner, who looks like a pain in the ass. To be honest, the selection of prizes isn't very good. It's all used dishes and used precious metals.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Volgo
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: It's quite a bad selection. Unfortunately, they don't seem to have any stuffed animals, but I don't mind. What's important is the feeling. I'll choose one of these as my memento for today.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Volgo
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: ...Hnn?

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Volgo
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
Conductor, take a look.
That rifle, do you remember seeing it anywhere?

Volgo points to an old gun propped up on a shelf of prizes.
She ponders for a moment, then looks up.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Volgo
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: I remember now. Nina of the Borderline. It's the gun that Nina's favorite rifle is modeled after. You see, it has an ivy design on the barrel. There are only a few of these left in the world, and they are very valuable.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Volgo
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
I've heard it's fetched a pretty penny between gun enthusiasts and Nina fans,
but I never thought I'd see it here.

I hurriedly take out my novel and check the illustrations.
Sure enough, it's the same design as Nina's favorite gun. I definitely want it!
Hearing Volgo's words, guests begin to gather around.

This is bad. If I don't hurry, someone else will get it!
Shopkeeper, I need a gun and cork bullets!

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Volgo
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Conductor. You want that gun?

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Volgo
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Oh, okay. If that's what you want, we'll get it. I'll take care of it.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Volgo
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Shopkeeper, give me the gun. As for the cork bullets, well, two should be enough. I would have said one, but the toy gun has a distorted barrel that makes it difficult to aim.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Volgo
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
I hereby declare...the first shot is a throwaway.
First, I'll assess the trajectory, and then...

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Volgo
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: I'll hit it on the second shot.
Volgo puts one foot on the platform with a thump and holds up the toy gun. She takes aim and fires the first shot. With a bang, the cork bullet bounces off the wall.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Volgo
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Okay, I got a read. I'll get it next time.

There's a line behind us. If she misses it,
Nina's gun will be in the hands of someone else. I want her to win at all costs.
The air is tense. Volgo's finger is on the trigger. And then―

Bang! Immediately after that, Nina's gun lurches and slowly falls.
She has hit the jackpot.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Volgo
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: I told you, didn't I? I said I was gonna get it for you.
After a moment's pause, a cheer rises.

―Wow! You took down a heavy target like that with a cork bullet!
―You hit it with a thin barrel. You're no average girl!
As the crowd applauds, we make our way through the onlookers to the street.

Well, I'm impressed. You're a woman of your word. Thank you, Volgo!
When I turn around, Volgo is slumped against the wall with her hands on her head.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Volgo
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Why...why did this happen? I was going to be the main girl and have you get the stuffed animal. The next thing I knew, my body was doing the work on its own, and I had a bunch of lines.
Well, it's okay. Don't be so downhearted. That was force majeure, or maybe it was my fault for wanting the gun. I'll take over from here. Now, let's continue.
I take Volgo's hand and stroke her head. It's now that I decide it's time for me to take the lead, and I'm about to gently embrace Volgo.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Volgo
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Hey, Conductor. Can I ask you something?

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Volgo
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
What happened to Nina's gun that I just got? I can't seem to find it.
Did you leave it at the store, or did you drop it somewhere?
Huh? I don't know what you're talking about. The gun is sitting right there―
―It's gone!?

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Volgo
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Where the hell did it go?

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Volgo
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Ahh, that's what I thought.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Volgo
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Conductor, it looks like we'll have to put off the rest of the romance novel.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Volgo
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Look, there it is. You see that? The owner of the shooting shop is trying to escape with the gun. I guess he found out its worth and didn't want to give it up.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Volgo
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
But don't worry, I'll get it back. The back of a target that is trying to escape is easier to aim at than a target that is motionless. That's what Nina said,
and I agree with her.
Volgo puts her gun on her back and runs off.
